byline.contributor: Ian Lovett reported from Los Angeles, and Christine Hauser and Richard Pérez-Peña from New York. Christopher Mele contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By IAN LOVETT, RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA and CHRISTINE HAUSER

abstract: Los Angeles police say gunman in shooting that led to lockdown of campus at University of California, Los Angeles, is dead; gunman is reported to have killed Prof William S Klug and then killed himself and police say there are no additional suspects.

headline.print_headline: Shooting on U.C.L.A. Campus Was Murder-Suicide, Police Say
headline.main: U.C.L.A. Shooting Was Murder-Suicide, Police Say

snippet: Reports of a shooting prompted thousands of frightened students and staff members to hunker down or run for shelter until the all-clear was sounded.
lead_paragraph: Reports of a shooting prompted thousands of frightened students and staff members to hunker down or run for shelter until the all-clear was sounded.
